claim: Selective builds and merge queues are necessary to keep monorepo CI scalable and green.
notes: Buildkite documents selective builds and merge queues as standard practice for high-volume monorepos to avoid redundant CI runs and stale baselines.

claim: Remote caching can be enabled with minimal configuration on modern monorepo toolchains.
notes: Turborepo requires only token/team secrets before running cached tasks, and Bazel roadmap emphasizes remote cache as a simple performance win.

claim: Remote caching always improves performance without trade-offs
notes: Sources highlight fallback and network reliability concerns, implying remote caches can slow builds under poor network conditions.
